head.title: A Desperate Search for Relief, and for Answers; A Question of Leadership

hedline.hl1: A Desperate Search for Relief, and for Answers; A Question of Leadership

block.p: When will President Bush finally ask us all to make a sacrifice? With the war in Iraq, rising oil prices and more Americans in poverty, now is a good time to ask Americans to share the burden by parking our cars and S.U.V.'s for the long Labor Day weekend and staying home to reflect.

When will President Bush finally ask us all to make a sacrifice? With the war in Iraq, rising oil prices and more Americans in poverty, now is a good time to ask Americans to share the burden by parking our cars and S.U.V.'s for the long Labor Day weekend and staying home to reflect.

Eliminating unnecessary trips would cut gasoline consumption, lower gas prices, cut greenhouse gases and make us less dependent on foreign oil. It would also make us more aware of how the little things and people acting together can make a difference.
